result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon A. Sledge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brandon A. Sledge is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brandon A. Sledge was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Brandon A. Sledge was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cts 2 & 4 are concurrent to each other BUT consecutive to 14CF1242 & 14CF596

miscConds.notes:
Bond applied  -  Balance still due.
If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
May not have contact with Rudy L, Jordan M, Anthony M, Kendra G, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent. No relationship with person of opposite sex without approval of agent.

From linked case #14CF596.  ds/cp

of disposition of case; deft released from custody as to this file only.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Barth.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions, concurrent on cts 2 & 4 and consecutive to 14CF1242 & 14CF596; deft to pay $450 DNA surcharge; credit for 32 days served if revoked.
from Defendant

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Barth.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 1, 3 & 5 are dismissed.  Deft pleads no contest to cts 2 & 4. Court finds deft guilty of cts 2 & 4.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 6/17/15 at 3:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Barth.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Barth states they are working toward resolution.  STC continued to 5/6/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Barth.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Barth states he is new to the case and needs to meet w/ADA McNeill to ensure he has all discovery.  STC continued to 3/25/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
Atty Michael Barth

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Lassiter states the deft would like new public defender representation.  Deft agrees.  Court allows Atty Lassiter to withdraw.  STC continued to 3/4/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Atty C Lassiter appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but not brought over.  Atty Lassiter states she still needs to review video with deft in the jail.  STC continued to 1/21/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Lassiter states they have been provided with global resolution offer.  JS of 12/8/14 at 9am is removed from the calendar; STC is set for 12/12/14 at 10am.  Bond continued.

Judge Chad Kerkman, Acting Br. 6 for today only.  Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case is not resolved.  Jury status hearing 12/4/14 at 1:15.  Jury selection 12/8/14 at 9:00.  Jury trial 12/9/14 at 9:00.  Bond continued.
Preliminary Hearing Offer Memo

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Carmen Lassiter. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 10-6-14 @ 10:30am with 14CF596/885. Bond continued.
